COMMENT_TX: $Bob Jones was trapped between 2B & 3B; Joe Sewell's throw hit Jones on the back

$the Tigers thought Maurice Archdeacon was out and left the field; Lu Blue threw the ball away and Archdeacon raced around the bases as the crowd swarmed the field; Police had to drive the crowd away; the crowd stood around the outfield and in foul territory a dozen deep when play was resumed
$Willie Kamm collided with Topper Rigney as the latter cut off the throw to 2B; Kamm was spiked on the left foot, so Bibb Falk in as a courtesy runner

$Heinie Manush made it back to 2B safely, but found Harry Heilmann there; the bag belonged to Manush so Sarge Connolly tagged Heilmann, who walked away; Manush, evidently confused, also walked off the bag and Connolly tagged him
pbp account ends here, rest deduced

$the Browns argued this should have been a home run; Umpire Tommy Connolly inspected the field and allowed the HR; play was suspended when Ty Cobb and other Tigers raced out into RF, took the ball away from the fan who caught it after it had bounced off the screen; the two umpires then went out to the Browns bull pen to interview two Brown pitchers on the subject; the decision was then reversed and the runners were sent back to 2B and 3B
pbp account ends here, rest deduced

ej,coleb101,P,evanb901,Throwing at batter ej,meusb101,P,evanb901,Charging mound $Bob Meusel threw down his bat, rushed the mound, and both benches emptied; Meusel and Bert Cole ejected by HP umpire Billy Evans; the players had just about returned to their respective positions when Meusel and Bush went over to the Tiger dugout and another fight started; attempts to restore order failed; Evans forfeited the game to the Yankees
ej,burkl101,P,ormsr901,Called third strike $Les Burke ejected by HP umpire Red Ormsby
ej,fewsc101,P,hildg101,Call at 1B $Chick Fewster ejected by 1B umpire George Hildebrand
$George Uhle left with an injured ankle
$the ball caromed off the 1B bag; Ted Lyons rounded 3B and started back to the bag, but Harry Hooper advanced to 3B, so Lyons let himself be tagged
$landed in a lumber yard across the street
